summary.overview: The application is a web-based music player that allows users to play, pause, and navigate through a playlist of songs. It provides visual feedback through a progress bar and displays the current song's title and cover image.
summary.predefined_options: The application has a predefined playlist consisting of three songs: 'hey', 'summer', and 'ukulele'. These are set by the system and loaded dynamically.

requirements.description: When the user clicks the play button, the system should start playing the current song, change the play button icon to a pause icon, and add a 'play' class to the music container.
When the user clicks the pause button, the system should pause the current song, change the pause button icon back to a play icon, and remove the 'play' class from the music container.
When the user clicks the next button, the system should switch to the next song in the playlist, update the song title and cover image, and start playing the song.
When the user clicks the previous button, the system should switch to the previous song in the playlist, update the song title and cover image, and start playing the song.
While the song is playing, the system should update the progress bar to reflect the current playback position in real-time.
When the user clicks on the progress bar, the system should adjust the playback position to the corresponding time based on where the user clicked.
When a song ends, the system should automatically transition to the next song in the playlist and start playing it.
Upon loading the application, the system should initialize by loading the first song in the playlist, displaying its title and cover image.
